intro: Herpestis calytriplex, commonly known as the narrow-leafed herb, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-white blooms that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Herpestis calytriplex is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
